name: Thoracic Outlet Syndrome with Venous Compression
chief_complaint: My arm swells and turns blue when I raise it, and I have constant aching in my shoulder
physical_findings: decreased radial pulse with arm elevation
prognosis: Good with early intervention, may have recurrent symptoms if untreated. Surgical success rate 70-90% for venous TOS
description: Compression of the subclavian vein as it passes through the thoracic outlet, causing venous obstruction and upper extremity symptoms. Often seen in repetitive overhead activities or post-traumatic cases. Can lead to Paget-Schroetter syndrome if thrombosis occurs.
multiple_choice: Thoracic Outlet Syndrome with Venous Compression
